case_vignette: A new mother brings in her 2-week-old son because of a painful itchy rash on his trunk. Vital signs are within normal limits. A basic chemistry panel reveal sodium 135 mmol/L, potassium 4.1 mmol/L, chloride 107 mmol/L, carbon dioxide 22, blood urea nitrogen 30 mg/dL, creatinine 1.1 mg/dL, and glucose 108 mg/dL. On physical examination of the newborn, there are confluent erythematous patches with tiny vesicles and scaling. His mother notes that she has been bathing the patient twice a day.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?
